name: drowse
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to sleep lightly for a short time, or to be almost asleep: Exhausted by their exercise, they were content to drowse in the sun. Drowsing before dinner one evening, I was brought to my senses by a great thud on the roof.
More examplesFewer examplesHe was photographed drowsing with a newspaper in his lap.The students were drowsing in their deck-chairs.Although they took it in turns to stay on watch, the one who was supposedly sleeping never did more than drowse, coming awake with a violent start at every rustling leaf.

a period of light sleep, or a period when someone is almost asleep: She had woken from her early evening drowse. I fell into a drowse again until there was another emergency brake.
More examplesFewer examplesShe awoke from a light drowse to the distant strains of Tchaikovsky's Violin Concerto.He began to drop into a drowse once more.The music carried a charge that could snap you out of your after-dinner drowse.
